messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] unschoolers at school
messages.msgSnippet: ... football ... Now that s dumb.  I d  think that schools would welcome homeschooled students, both for the $$, and hoping that our kids would see the light
messages.messageBody:
> I think that is WONDERFUL, because when a friend of mine signed up for high
> school here to play football, they wouldn't even let him take HISTORY. They
> said he could ONLY take English, math and science if he wanted to go half
> time.He had to prove he could make a 3.0 since they were making the other
football
> players make a 3.0.

Now that's dumb. I'd think that schools would welcome homeschooled
students, both for the $$, and hoping that our kids would "see the light"
and come back for good.

I truly do wish that the school here could manage to be a good experience.
But it's ranked 2nd from the bottom of DODDS schools worldwide, and the
biggest lesson Tim learned was that in school, they tell you to sit down and
be quiet a lot. School prompted several interesting discussions about why
we do what we do!

brenda
